Class PlayerBoard

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Boards.PlayerBoard
public class PlayerBoard extends Object
The PlayerBoard class represents a player's spaceship board in the Galaxy Trucker game. This class manages the grid-based board where players place tiles to build their spaceship, handles connections between tiles, manages various components (engines, drills, storage, etc.), tracks damage and shields, and validates the board's structural integrity.

The board is represented as a 10x10 grid where tiles can be placed according to specific rules and constraints. The class also handles the ship's attributes like crew, energy, stored goods, and various alien bonuses.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Tile placement and removal management
  • Connection validation between adjacent tiles
  • Board integrity checking using depth-first search algorithms
  • Component management (engines, drills, shields, etc.)
  • Damage tracking and handling
  • Goods storage and retrieval
  • Event notification to listeners
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Francesco Rausa

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerBoard

      public PlayerBoard(int lv)
      Constructs a new PlayerBoard with the specified level configuration. Initializes the board grid, validity matrix, and all component lists. Sets up the valid placement areas based on the level (different ship sizes).
      Parameters:
      lv - the level of the player board (affects the valid placement area) Level 2 has a different valid area configuration than other levels

  • Method Details

    • setTotalValue

      public void setTotalValue(int i)
      Adds the specified value from the cargo to the total value of the player board and updates the info display.
      Parameters:
      i - the value to add to the total value

    • getTotalValue

      public int getTotalValue()
      Retrieves the current total value of the player board.
      Returns:
      the total value accumulated on this player board

    • insertBuffer

      public void insertBuffer(Tile t) throws IllegalStateException
      Inserts a tile into the buffer for later placement on the board. The buffer can hold a maximum of 2 tiles.
      Parameters:
      t - the tile to be inserted into the buffer
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the buffer is already full (contains 2 tiles)
      InvalidInput - if the tile is null (hand is empty)

    • getTileFromBuffer

      public Tile getTileFromBuffer(int i)
      Retrieves and removes a tile from the buffer at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the tile to retrieve from the buffer
      Returns:
      the tile at the specified index
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - if the index is out of bounds or the buffer is empty

    • setRewardsListener

      public void setRewardsListener(RewardsListener listener)
      Sets the rewards listener that will be notified when rewards change.
      Parameters:
      listener - the RewardsListener to be set

      Sets the buffer goods list.
      Parameters:
      bufferGoods - the ArrayList of Goods to set as buffer goods

      Sets the power centers list.

      powerCenters - the ArrayList of PowerCenter to set

    • getExposedConnectors

      public int getExposedConnectors()
      Retrieves the number of exposed connectors on the player board. Exposed connectors are those that are not connected to adjacent tiles and can cause damage during meteor storms.
      Returns:
      the number of exposed connectors

    • getShield

      public int[] getShield()
      Retrieves the shield status of the player board. The shield is represented as an array of size 4, where each index corresponds to a direction:
      • Index 0 - Left
      • Index 1 - Top
      • Index 2 - Right
      • Index 3 - Bottom
      A value of 0 indicates no protection, while a non-zero value means the side is protected.
      Returns:
      an integer array of size 4 representing the shield status in each direction

    • getPlayerBoard

      public Tile[][] getPlayerBoard()
      Retrieves the player's board, which consists of a grid of tiles.
      Returns:
      a 2D array of Tile objects representing the player's board

    • getValidPlayerBoard

      public int[][] getValidPlayerBoard()
      Retrieves the validity matrix of the player board. Each cell indicates whether the position is valid for placement:
      • -1: Invalid position (outside ship boundaries)
      • 0: Valid empty position
      • 1: Position occupied by a tile
      Returns:
      a 2D array of integers representing the validity of each position

    • getDamage

      public int getDamage()
      Retrieves the current damage value of the player board. Damage is accumulated from various sources like meteor impacts, combat damage, and structural failures.
      Returns:
      the amount of damage sustained by the ship

    • getStoredGoods

      public HashMap<Integer,ArrayList<IntegerPair>> getStoredGoods()
      Retrieves the stored goods organized by their value. The HashMap maps goods values to lists of positions where those goods are stored.
      Returns:
      a HashMap where keys are goods values and values are lists of storage positions

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int x, int y) throws InvalidInput
      Retrieves the tile located at the specified coordinates on the player board.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the tile
      y - the y-coordinate of the tile
      Returns:
      the Tile object at the given coordinates
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - if the coordinates are out of bounds or point to an invalid tile

    • insertTile

      public void insertTile(Tile tile, int x, int y, boolean check) throws NullPointerException, InvalidInput
      Inserts a tile into the player board at the specified coordinates. Performs validation checks if the check parameter is true, including: - Null tile check - Bounds checking - Position availability - Adjacent tile requirement (except for position 6,6)
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile to be placed
      x - the x-coordinate where the tile should be placed
      y - the y-coordinate where the tile should be placed
      check - whether to perform validation checks
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the tile is null and check is true
      InvalidInput - if the coordinates are invalid, out of bounds, or position requirements are not met

    • checkConnection

      public boolean checkConnection(Connectors t1, Connectors t2)
      Checks whether two connectors can be legally connected. Validates both the legal connection type and adjacency requirements. Sets the board validity to false if an illegal connection is detected.
      Parameters:
      t1 - the first connector
      t2 - the second connector
      Returns:
      true if the connection is valid and adjacent, false otherwise

    • checkConnection

      public boolean checkConnection(Connectors t1, Connectors t2, int x, int y, ArrayList<IntegerPair> visited, int fromX, int fromY)
      Checks whether two connectors can be legally connected, with additional tracking for tiles that should be removed due to invalid connections. This version is used during board validation to mark problematic tiles in order to create the default command.
      Parameters:
      t1 - the first connector
      t2 - the second connector
      x - the x-coordinate of the second connector's tile
      y - the y-coordinate of the second connector's tile
      visited - list of already visited positions
      fromX - the x-coordinate of the first connector's tile
      fromY - the y-coordinate of the first connector's tile
      Returns:
      true if the connection is valid and adjacent, false otherwise

    • PathNotVisited

      public boolean PathNotVisited(ArrayList<IntegerPair> visited)
      Checks if there are any tiles that have not been reached by the pathfinding algorithm. Marks unreachable tiles for removal in the toRemovePB matrix.
      Parameters:
      visited - list of positions that have been visited during pathfinding
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one unreachable tile, false if all tiles are reachable

    • checkIllegal

      public boolean checkIllegal(ArrayList<IntegerPair> visited)
      Checks if there are any illegal component placements on the board. Validates that components like hot water heaters and plasma drills meet their specific placement requirements.
      Parameters:
      visited - list of positions representing the connected board area
      Returns:
      true if all components are legally placed, false if illegal placements exist

    • removeTile

      public void removeTile(int x, int y) throws InvalidInput
      Removes a tile from the player board at the specified coordinates. The tile is replaced with a SpaceVoid tile and the position is marked as empty. The main cockpit at position (6,6) cannot be removed.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the tile to remove
      y - the y-coordinate of the tile to remove
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - if the coordinates are out of bounds, invalid, or point to the main cockpit

    • checkValidity

      public boolean checkValidity()
      Validates the player board according to game rules. Checks that: - All tiles are reachable from the main cockpit - All connections between tiles are legal - Component placement constraints are satisfied - No tiles remain in the buffer (adds damage if any exist)
      Returns:
      true if the player board is valid, false otherwise

    • findPaths

      public void findPaths(int r, int c, ArrayList<IntegerPair> visited)
      Performs a depth-first search to find all reachable tiles from the starting position. Validates connections between adjacent tiles during traversal. Used for board integrity checking.
      Parameters:
      r - the starting x-coordinate
      c - the starting y-coordinate
      visited - list to track visited positions during the search

    • destroy

      public void destroy(int x, int y)
      Destroys a tile at the specified coordinates, replacing it with a SpaceVoid. Increases damage counter, updates board attributes, validates housing units, and updates stored goods locations.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the tile to destroy
      y - the y-coordinate of the tile to destroy

    • updateStoredGoods

      public void updateStoredGoods()
      Updates the stored goods locations by removing goods from destroyed tiles. Removes entries for positions that are no longer valid (ValidPlayerBoard != 1).

    • choosePlayerBoard

      public ArrayList<IntegerPair> choosePlayerBoard(IntegerPair input)
      Allows the player to choose which ship section to keep after the ship breaks apart. Searches through available ship sections to find the one containing the specified position.
      Parameters:
      input - the position (chunk) selected by the player
      Returns:
      the list of positions representing the chosen ship section
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - if the selected chunk doesn't exist in any ship section

    • modifyPlayerBoard

      public void modifyPlayerBoard(ArrayList<IntegerPair> newPlayerBoard)
      Modifies the player board to keep only the tiles in the specified section. All other tiles are removed and replaced with SpaceVoids. Increases damage for each removed tile and updates all board attributes.
      Parameters:
      newPlayerBoard - the list of positions representing the section to keep

    • updateAttributes

      public void updateAttributes(int x, int y)
      Resets and updates all board attributes starting from the specified coordinates. Clears exposed connectors and shield values, then recalculates them by traversing the connected board area.
      Parameters:
      x - the starting x-coordinate for attribute calculation
      y - the starting y-coordinate for attribute calculation

    • updateGlobalAttributes

      public void updateGlobalAttributes(ArrayList<IntegerPair> board)
      Updates global attributes for all tiles on the board by controlling their directions. This method iterates through each position in the provided board list and calls controlDirections for each tile to update its directional attributes.
      Parameters:
      board - ArrayList of IntegerPair coordinates representing tiles to update

    • updateBoardAttributes

      public void updateBoardAttributes(int r, int c, ArrayList<IntegerPair> visited)
      Method updateBoardAttributes updates all the attributes of the class also calculating the number of exposed connectors using the dfs algorithm.
      Parameters:
      r - of type int - x coordinate.
      c - of type int - y coordinate.
      visited - of type ArrayList<IntegerPair> - keeps track of all the tiles already visited.

    • handleAttack

      public void handleAttack(int x, int y)
      Method handleAttack finds all possible chunks after a tile is destroyed by calling findPaths for all 4 direction of the destroyed tile.
      Parameters:
      x - of type int - x coordinate of the destroyed Tile.
      y - of type int - y coordinate of the destroyed Tile.

    • getPurpleAlien

      public boolean getPurpleAlien()
      Gets the current status of the purple alien.
      Returns:
      true if purple alien is present, false otherwise

    • getBrownAlien

      public boolean getBrownAlien()
      Gets the current status of the brown alien.
      Returns:
      true if brown alien is present, false otherwise

    • setBrownAlien

      public void setBrownAlien(boolean brownAlien)
      Sets the brown alien status and updates board information.
      Parameters:
      brownAlien - true to activate brown alien, false to deactivate

    • setPurpleAlien

      public void setPurpleAlien(boolean purpleAlien)
      Sets the purple alien status and updates board information.
      Parameters:
      purpleAlien - true to activate purple alien, false to deactivate

    • getBufferGoods

      public ArrayList<Goods> getBufferGoods()
      Gets the list of goods currently in the buffer.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Goods in the buffer

    • getHousingUnits

      public ArrayList<HousingUnit> getHousingUnits()
      Gets the list of housing units on the player board.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of HousingUnit objects

    • getHotWaterHeaters

      public ArrayList<HotWaterHeater> getHotWaterHeaters()
      Gets the list of hot water heaters on the player board.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of HotWaterHeater objects

    • getPlasmaDrills

      public ArrayList<PlasmaDrill> getPlasmaDrills()
      Gets the list of plasma drills on the player board.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of PlasmaDrill objects

    • getAlienAddons

      public ArrayList<AlienAddons> getAlienAddons()
      Gets the list of alien addons on the player board.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of AlienAddons objects

    • getStorages

      public ArrayList<Storage> getStorages()
      Gets the list of storage units on the player board.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Storage objects

    • getShieldGenerators

      public ArrayList<ShieldGenerator> getShieldGenerators()
      Gets the list of shield generators on the player board.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of ShieldGenerator objects

    • getPowerCenters

      public ArrayList<PowerCenter> getPowerCenters()
      Gets the list of power centers on the player board.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of PowerCenter objects

    • getEnginePower

      public int getEnginePower()
      Gets the current engine power with alien bonus if applicable. Returns the base engine power plus 2 if brown alien is active.
      Returns:
      current engine power value

    • setEnginePower

      public void setEnginePower(int enginePower)
      Increases the engine power by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      enginePower - amount to add to current engine power

    • getPlasmaDrillsPower

      public double getPlasmaDrillsPower()
      Gets the current plasma drill power with alien bonus if applicable. Returns the base plasma drill power plus 2 if purple alien is active.
      Returns:
      current plasma drill power value

    • setPlasmaDrillsPower

      public void setPlasmaDrillsPower(double plasmaDrillsPower)
      Increases the plasma drill power by the specified amount and updates board info.
      Parameters:
      plasmaDrillsPower - amount to add to current plasma drill power

    • getNumHumans

      public int getNumHumans()
      Gets the current number of humans on the ship.
      Returns:
      number of humans

    • setNumHumans

      public void setNumHumans(int numHumans)
      Increases the number of humans by the specified amount and updates board info.
      Parameters:
      numHumans - number of humans to add

    • getEnergy

      public int getEnergy()
      Gets the current energy level.
      Returns:
      current energy value

    • setEnergy

      public void setEnergy(int energy)
      Increases the energy by the specified amount and updates board info.
      Parameters:
      energy - amount of energy to add

    • performAction

      public void performAction(Component component, ComponentAction action, PlayerState state)
      Performs a specified action on a component with the given player state.
      Parameters:
      component - the Component to perform action on
      action - the ComponentAction to execute
      state - the PlayerState context for the action

    • getBuffer

      public ArrayList<Tile> getBuffer()
      Gets the current tile buffer.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Tile objects in the buffer

    • setBuffer

      public void setBuffer(ArrayList<Tile> newBuffer)
      Sets the tile buffer to a new list of tiles.
      Parameters:
      newBuffer - new ArrayList of Tile objects to set as buffer

    • clone

      public PlayerBoard clone()
      Creates a deep copy of the current PlayerBoard instance. This method clones all essential properties including tiles, alien status, various component lists, and board state arrays.
      Returns:
      a new PlayerBoard instance that is a deep copy of this board

    • getRewardsListener

      public RewardsListener getRewardsListener()
      Gets the rewards listener for this player board.
      Returns:
      the RewardsListener instance

    • isBroken

      public boolean isBroken()
      Checks if the player board is in a broken state.
      Returns:
      true if the board is broken, false otherwise

    • getLv

      public int getLv()
      Gets the current level of the player board.
      Returns:
      the level value

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if the player board is in a valid state.
      Returns:
      true if the board is valid, false otherwise

    • isPurpleAlien

      public boolean isPurpleAlien()
      Checks if the purple alien is active.
      Returns:
      true if purple alien is active, false otherwise

    • isBrownAlien

      public boolean isBrownAlien()
      Checks if the brown alien is active.
      Returns:
      true if brown alien is active, false otherwise

    • setRewards

      public void setRewards(ArrayList<Goods> rewards)
      Sets the rewards list and notifies listeners of the change.
      Parameters:
      rewards - ArrayList of Goods to set as rewards

    • getRewards

      public ArrayList<Goods> getRewards()
      Gets the current rewards list.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Goods representing current rewards

    • getFromRewards

      public Goods getFromRewards(int i)
      Removes and returns a specific reward from the rewards list.
      Parameters:
      i - index of the reward to remove
      Returns:
      the Goods object that was removed
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - if the index is out of bounds or rewards list is empty

    • getBroken

      public boolean getBroken()
      Gets the broken status of the player board.
      Returns:
      true if the board is broken, false otherwise

    • getConnectedHousingUnits

      public ArrayList<HousingUnit> getConnectedHousingUnits()
      Gets the list of connected housing units.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of connected HousingUnit objects

    • setListener

      public void setListener(PlayerBoardListener listener)
      Sets the player board listener for receiving board change events.
      Parameters:
      listener - the PlayerBoardListener to set

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener()
      Removes the current player board listener.

    • getListener

      public PlayerBoardListener getListener()
      Gets the current player board listener.
      Returns:
      the current PlayerBoardListener instance

    • sendUpdates

      public void sendUpdates(TileEvent event)
      Sends tile update events to the registered listener.
      Parameters:
      event - the TileEvent to send to the listener

    • finishRace

      public int finishRace(boolean finished)
      Calculates the final score for the race based on stored goods, damage, and credits. If the race is not finished, the score is halved (rounded up for odd numbers).
      Parameters:
      finished - true if the race was completed, false if not finished
      Returns:
      the calculated final score

    • updateInfo

      public void updateInfo()
      Updates the board information and notifies listeners of changes. Calculates crew count including aliens and creates a PBInfoEvent with current board statistics.

    • setCredits

      public void setCredits(int num)
      Increases the credits by the specified amount and updates board information.
      Parameters:
      num - amount of credits to add (can be negative to subtract)

    • getToRemovePB

      public int[][] getToRemovePB()
      Gets the array representing tiles to be removed from the player board.
      Returns:
      2D int array representing positions of tiles to remove
